alert.note: Alert for South Washington Coast (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 27 at 2:58AM PST until December 28 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH 10 PM THIS EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, sneaker waves possible. For the High Surf Advisory, large waves and hazardous surf conditions. Breakers up to 30 feet. * WHERE...In Oregon, North Oregon Coast and Central Oregon Coast. In Washington, South Washington Coast. * WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, through 10 PM evening. For the High Surf Advisory, from 10 PM this evening to 4 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Destructive waves may wash over beaches, jetties, and other structures unexpectedly. People can be swept off rocks and jetties and drown while observing high surf. Minor beach erosion may damage coastal properties and buildings. Higher than normal water run-up is expected on beaches and low-lying shoreline.
info.instruction: A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches, producing rip currents, sneaker waves and beach erosion. Stay well back from the water`s edge and be alert for exceptionally high waves. Keep away from large logs on the beach. Water running up on the beach can easily lift or roll logs which can injure or kill someone caught in their path. Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.
